discussion_comments.comment_body: Are you wanting this file to be included in the distributed package?
I'm not sure, probably the same as whatever we do for the other packages. I saw the other packages didn't have a README.md and instead had a PACAKGE.md

Other packages don't include `PACKAGE.md` in their released artifacts.  I believe they use `PACKAGE.md` because the `README.md` is a common one that is put into all of the [generated packages](https://app.unpkg.com/@angular/forms@20.2.3/files/README.md), sourced from `./packages/README.md`
Ok, I probably want the same here then, which I think is how its currently setup? It's not included in the `ng_project`, just the docs

I clarified the docs to be for angular v19, I was using `@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser` and tailwindcss wasn't compiling no matter what configuration changes I did. I reverted my `angular.json` to use `@angular-devkit/build-angular:application` and it started compiling again
the issue was not that the style file wasn't referenced, though, that is something that is required if you're using TailwindCSSv4 and Angularv19 which is not mentioned in either docs
